referralLink.title: Simple Arithematic questions on Multiplication
referralLink.description: Are you ready for DKT test? Try simulation test before you go for final test.

referralLink.title: Simple Arithematic questions on Substraction
referralLink.description: Government website for all informationunder one umbrella.

options: Go to the RTA and ask them to renew your registration and tell them you will soon get the car fixed
You have seven days to have the car repaired, after which the RTA considers it to be unregistered.
After today you must not drive the car until it has been repaired, passed another inspection and registered.
questions.qn: Your car registration expires today. You have your car inspected for registration renewal but it fails the inspection. What should you do?

options: No, it's illegal to drive a car with a smooth tyre even if it is the spare.
Yes, but you must get the puncture fixed within 24 hours.
Yes, if the tyre is correctly inflated and the side walls of the tyre are in good condition.
questions.qn: You buy a car and find that the spare tyre is smooth; the tread is only just visible. If you get a puncture will it be legal to drive the car with a smooth spare tyre?

options: Ask your friend for a cushion to place behind your back.
Put up with the discomfort; you should not adjust another person's seat.
Adjust the seat forward so it's right for you.
questions.qn: You borrow a friend's car and find that the position of the driver's seat puts you sitting a long way from the steering wheel and controls. What should you do?

options: You can continue to drive at 100 km/h if there are fences to stop farm animals from getting on the road.
Slow down to a speed that will allow you to stop to avoid crashing into farm animals on the road.
For the next 5 kilometres you must not exceed 60 km/h unless you pass an end farm animals speed limit sign.
questions.qn: You hold an unrestricted licence and are driving at 100 km/h in the country and pass this sign. What should you do?

options: Indicating in this situation is optional. Give a right hand signal if you think it will help other road users.
You should not indicate at all because it might confuse other drivers.
Indicate with your right hand signal the same as any other right hand turn.
questions.qn: You are turning right from one of two right turn only lanes. How should you use your indicators?

options: Yes, providing you use the gravel joining roads.
Yes, any time.
No, not at any time.
questions.qn: You are driving on a freeway and realise you forgot something at home. You want to go back for it. Can you do a U-turn on this road?

options: Ask an older person sitting nearby to watch the child.
Take the child with you.
Leave the child in the car.
questions.qn: You have a six year old child with you in your car. You have just parked so you can collect a prescription from the chemist. You should -

options: Put the handbrake on and put the transmission in 'P' (park).
Park only on flat areas.
Turn the wheels away from the kerb.
questions.qn: You want to leave your automatic car parked on a street sloping uphill. You should -

options: Yes, but only in daylight hours.
Yes.
No, not at any time.
questions.qn: You have just passed this sign. Can you park on this road ?

options: At least two metres from the dividing lines.
At least three metres from the dividing lines.
One metre from the dividing lines.
questions.qn: Where there are double dividing lines, you may park -

options: No, only N is correct.
Yes. M, N and O are all legal.
Yes, N is best but M and O are quite legal.
questions.qn: If there are no signs or markings to advise you, can you choose any of these methods of parking?

options: Where there are markings or a sign indicating angle park.
Where the road is very wide.
Where there is plenty of room from the centre line.
questions.qn: You should angle park -

options: Maintain your speed, keeping to the limit.
Sound your horn to warn the other driver.
Slow down and pay extra attention.
questions.qn: This bridge has only just enough room for two vehicles. As you come close to it you should -

options: Mirror B.
Mirror A.
Mirror C.
questions.qn: Which side mirror is adjusted best?

options: The building blocks a good view of the side street.
Intersections cause crashes.
It looks a bit tricky.
questions.qn: You should be particularly careful at this intersection because -

options: Go slower because the slower you go the safer you are.
Overtake the bike quickly and speed up to stop the other driver becoming aggressive
Resist the pressure, stay calm and overtake the cyclist when it is safe.
questions.qn: You are in busy traffic and slow down for a bicycle rider. A driver behind you beeps a horn and pressures you to go around the bike and drive faster. How should you respond?

options: Slow down to the speed of other traffic.
Move into the left lane.
Continue at the same speed.
questions.qn: You hear the siren of an ambulance approaching you from behind. You should -

options: Move to the right and make way for the ambulance.
Turn into a driveway on the right hand side of the road.
Move to the left and make way for the ambulance.
questions.qn: You are driving along this road. You hear an ambulance's siren and see the ambulance in your mirror. You should -

options: Stop and let the fire truck overtake you.
Continue and make the turn because you have the right of way
Speed up to beat the fire truck.
questions.qn: You are about to make a right hand turn at this intersection. You have the green light. You hear a siren and then see that a fire truck will soon overtake you. You should -

options: You only have to obey the signs during working hours.
You only have to obey the signs when there are workers about.
You must obey the signs that are displayed at all times.
questions.qn: When you come across roadworks -
